p: Temperature impacts crop phenology and each species has a specific lower temperature value or base temperature, an optimum temperature value, and an upper temperature limit ( Hatfield et al., 2011). Increases in temperature above the optimum have shown a negative impact on wheat yield with a projected 5.3% ( Innes et al., 2015), and 6% ( Asseng et al., 2015) yield reduction per 1Â°C rise. In wheat, exposure to frost or high temperatures during pollination has a significant effect on yield ( Prasad and Djanaguiraman, 2014; Rezaei et al., 2015).
